isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - ADJUSTMENTS - HOOD ADJUSTMENT

svcprocinfo.para: Improper positioning of the hood relative to the cab can cause the tilt mechanism to malfunction and can interfere with engine components. The front of the hood is to be at the proper height, which will allow a parallel gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the bumper, this height is fixed and can not be adjusted. The hood is centered so the clearances for the radiator and air intake box-to-splash panels and shock absorbers are adequate.

Before adjusting the hood, be sure the chassis is on a level surface and the hood is mounted properly to the front of the chassis, square the cab on the chassis and adjust cab air ride. Adjust the radiator on the 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood, refer to Radiator Adjustment 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
. For CAB SQUARING and CAB AIR RIDE ADJUSTMENT, refer to GROUP 16-CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Perform the following procedure for a new hood installation, or for a hood that has been removed and is being installed, to assure that the hood is positioned correctly relative to the cab, front bumper and radiator.
To adjust the hood on the 5000 i Series and 9000 i Series Models with and without cab air suspension system to achieve the proper spacing between the hood and cowl, use the following procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Hood Hinge Bracket on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) with Tilt Hood

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for all items in parentheses.
To adjust the hood hinge bracket (Item 1) forward or back (Item 2) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) models, the hood hinge bracket is not adjustable up or down; the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is fixed.

figure.caption: Figure 57. Hood Adjustment Hex Bolts and Nuts on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) with Tilt Hood

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ADJUSTMENT IN DIRECTION OF ARROW FORWARD OR BACK

step1.para: Make two wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, try to place the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1) between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3) on each side, with spacer blocks resting against the cowl flange (Item 4). If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.

If the hood requires adjustment, first remove the grille. Refer to Remove Hood Grille on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA) and 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) or 9400 i (SBA) models. Refer to Remove Hood Grille on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 9900 i (SFA) or 9900 ix (SFA) models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: This will allow access to the three hood hinge bracket hex bolts (Item 3). The hex nuts (Item 4) are welded to the bottom of the hood hinge bracket mounting plate (Item 5).
With the hood assembly in the closed position, release the hood latches on each side of the hood.

Reach through the grille opening and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the three hood hinge bracket hex bolts (Item 3). With the aid of an assistant, push the hood forward or back (Item 2) at the hood hinge bracket (Item 1) to allow the spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58), one each side of the hood, to be placed between the hood (Item 2, Figure 58) and cowl (Item 3, Figure 58) and against the cowl flange (Item 4, Figure 58).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the spacer blocks (Item 1) held in position between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3), push the rear edge of the hood against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced top to bottom and pushed back against the cowl flange (Item 4), then latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58) and the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set. Check for equal spacing between the cowl flange and the inside edge of the hood. Tighten the three hood hinge bracket hex bolts (Item 3). Tighten to 80 to 105 ft-lbs. (108 to 142 N•m).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood.
Remove the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Latch the hood on both sides.

Once hood adjustment is complete, install the grille. Refer to Install Hood Grille on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA) and 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA) or 9400 i (SBA) models. Refer to Install Hood Grille on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) models.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Hood Hinge Bracket on 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 59 for all items in parentheses.
To adjust the hood hinge brackets (Item 1) forward or back (Item 2) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) models, the hood hinge brackets are not adjustable up or down; the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is fixed.

figure.caption: Figure 59. Hood Adjustment Hex Lock Nuts on 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ADJUSTMENT IN DIRECTION OF ARROW FORWARD OR BACK

step1.para: Make two wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, try to place the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1) between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3) on each side, with spacer blocks resting against the cowl flange (Item 4). If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.

If the hood requires adjustment, first remove the grille. Refer to Remove Hood Grille on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA) and 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 5500 i (SFA) or 5600 i (SBA) models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 59 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: This will allow access to the two hood hinge brackets (Item 1). The two flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3) are under the bottom of the hood hinge bracket mounting plate (Item 4).
With the hood assembly in the closed position, release the hood latches on each side of the hood.

Reach under the front bumper and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the two hood hinge bracket flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3) on each of the two hood hinge bracket weld studs (Item 5). With the aid of an assistant, push the hood forward or back (Item 2) at the hood hinge brackets (Item 1) to allow the spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58), one each side of the hood, to be placed between the hood (Item 2, Figure 58) and cowl (Item 3, Figure 58) and against the cowl flange (Item 4, Figure 58).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the spacer blocks (Item 1) held in position between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3), push the rear edge of the hood against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced top to bottom and pushed back against the cowl flange (Item 4), then latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 59 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58) and the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set. Check for equal spacing between the cowl flange and the inside edge of the hood. Make sure the hood hinge brackets (Item 1) are pointing straight ahead and tighten the two flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3) on each of the hood hinge bracket weld studs (Item 5). Tighten to 80 to 105 ft-lbs. (108 to 142 N•m).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood.
Remove the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Latch the hood on both sides.

Once hood adjustment is complete, install the grille. Refer to Install Hood Grille on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA) and 5500 i (SFA) and 5600 i (SBA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 5500 i (SFA) or 5600 i (SBA) models.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Hinge Bracket on 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 60 for all items in parentheses.
To adjust the hood hinge brackets (Item 1) forward or back (Item 2) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 5900 i (SFA) model, the hood hinge brackets are not adjustable up or down; the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is fixed.

figure.caption: Figure 60. Hood Adjustment Hex Lock Nuts on 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ADJUSTMENT IN DIRECTION OF ARROW FORWARD OR BACK

step1.para: Make two wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, try to place the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1) between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3) on each side, with spacer blocks resting against the cowl flange (Item 4). If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.

If the hood requires adjustment, first remove the grille. Refer to Refer to Remove Hood Grille on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 5900 i (SFA) model.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 60 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: This will allow access to the two flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3) on the two hood hinge bracket weld studs (Item 4) of the two hood hinge brackets (Item 1). The two hood hinge brackets are mounted under the bottom of the hood hinge bracket mounting plate (Item 5).
With the hood assembly in the closed position, release the hood latches on each side of the hood.

Reach through the grille opening and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the two flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3). With the aid of an assistant, push the hood forward or back (Item 2) at the hood hinge brackets (Item 1) to allow the spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58), one each side of the hood, to be placed between the hood (Item 2, Figure 58) and cowl (Item 3, Figure 58) and against the cowl flange (Item 4, Figure 58).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the spacer blocks (Item 1) held in position between the hood (Item 2) and cowl (Item 3), push the rear edge of the hood against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced top to bottom and pushed back against the cowl flange (Item 4), then latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 60 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks (Item 1, Figure 58) and the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set. Check for equal spacing between the cowl flange and the inside edge of the hood. Tighten the two flanged hex lock nuts (Item 3). Tighten to 80 to 105 ft-lbs. (108 to 142 N•m).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood.
Remove the two hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Latch the hood on both sides.

Once hood adjustment is complete, install the grille. Refer to Install Hood Grille on 9900 i (SFA), 9900 ix (SFA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
if adjusting the hood on a 5900 i (SFA) model.
